meanings.definition: To rave or speak in an extremely excited or enthusiastic manner.
meanings.sent1: After watching the concert, she couldn't stop outraving about the amazing performance.
meanings.sent2: She always outraves about her favorite book to anyone who will listen.
meanings.sent3: At the party, he was outraving about his new video game, making everyone want to try it.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement for the upcoming trip was outraving, like a firework lighting up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The children's laughter filled the room, outraving any other sound with pure joy.

meanings.definition: To surpass or outdo in raving or enthusiasm.
meanings.sent1: His energy outraving all others on the dance floor, making him the center of attention.
meanings.sent2: The team's spirit outraved their opponents, leading them to victory.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful antics outraved those of the older dogs at the park.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness outraved any negativity, spreading warmth wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The sun's brilliance outraved the stars, shining brightly in the daytime sky.
